title: Naomi Osaka Net Worth
body_text:
Naomi Osaka Net Worth
Naomi Osaka is one of the most well-known female tennis players in the world, and it’s all thanks to her father who, after seeing the Williams sisters play, taught Osaka and her sister to play tennis from a young age. Osaka trained at the little-known Pembroke Pines public courts in Queens and participated in the premier international junior tour.
Although one of his daughters, Mari retired early in her professional tennis player, his efforts paid off through Naomi who managed to continue and even win against her childhood idol Serena Williams. Today, Naomi Osaka is the only Japanese tennis player to win the grand slam singles championship and is a trailblazer in so many ways.
She has a career-high singles ranking of no.1 on the ITF junior circuit.
Naomi Osaka’s net worth
Naomi Osaka’s net worth is sitting at 60 million dollars as of this writing and she is currently the highest paid female athlete. Her road to riches began when she was crowned WTA newcomer in the year in 2016. At just 18 years of age, Naomi had achieved so much as a young woman, including making it through the WTA tour finals and breaking into the top 50 of the WTA rankings.
Today, her annual earnings are sitting at $ 50 million and Naomi Osaka’s endorsements by well-known brands like Workday, Louis Viton, and Airbnb continue to be very profitable. In fact, Osaka currently has 20 sponsors with a view to adding more in the future.
The year 2018 was great for Osaka because it was the first time that she won a Grand Slam title, and she achieved this by beating her idol and tennis great, Serena William.
This win helped to put Osaka’s home country of Japan on the map and today she is recognized as the first woman in Japan to win a grand slam final and has quickly become the best woman tennis player around the world.
Naomi Osaka professional career
Naomi Osaka has made a big name for herself through her incredible tennis skills. While her career started at a very early age, everything fell into place when Osaka became the first Asian woman to win a grand slam final, and in 2019 she followed that up by defeating Petra Kvitova to win the Australian Open and winning the Pan Pacific.
In the same year, Osaka defeated Ashleigh Barty to claim a win in the Beijing finals, making it one of the most successful years for her.
She also reached the highest ranking compared to her peers in the tournament and soon became the highest-paid woman in the championship.
Soon after her 2019 championship win, Osaka decided to go solo by leaving her long-time mentor and coach Sascha Bajin. She remained without a coach for a while before moving on to trainer Jermaine Jenkins, a partnership that only lasted for six months.
Recently, she is under the training of Wim Fissette who is known to have successfully coached former number ones such as Victoria Azarenka, Kim Clijsters, Simona Halep, and Angelique Kerber. Hopefully, Osaka has found a coach that suits her evolving style and will continue to thrive under Fissette’s leadership. In 2020, Osaka took home her third grand slam after going against Victoria Azarenk at the 2020 US open.
Challenges and Setbacks
2022 has been a rocky year for Osaka, starting with having to pull out of a game in the Australian Open also known as the Happy Slam Tournament semis, due to an abdominal injury. Osaka was all set to play Amanda Anisimova to the end, but it was just not meant to be. Although she had the upper hand for at least two straight rounds during the intense game, she faltered in the third, eventually handing the win to Anisimova.
It was at this point that rumors of her injuries surfaced, with Osaka herself admitting that although she wanted to continue playing, her injuries would not allow her to do so. At the end of the day, she fell and ended up losing the match as a result.
Despite all her struggles, Osaka remains one of the most marketable athletes in the world. In addition to her partnerships with the brands mentioned above, she boasts a bevy of loyal sponsors, such as Yonex and Nike. Of course, she is also the ambassador of popular Japanese car manufacturer Nissan Motors and the Japanese electronics citizen Watch.
Personal Life Osaka
Naomi Osaka was born in Japan to a Haitian father and a Japanese mother, Tamaki Osaka. Her family is based in the US and that is where her father began training both her and her sister with the vision to one day see his daughters represent Japan in the world state. And as we all know, his vision is today a reality.
She has a Nissan GT R Nismo thanks to being a brand ambassador for Nissan Motor. She is still very much connected to her Japanese roots. She often makes references to Japanese culture on her social media.
Fund Facts About Naomi Osaka
- Naomi Osaka is dating American rapper and personality YBN Cordae.
- She has a heart of gold and does lots of charity work. For example, when the COVID-19 crisis hit in 2020, she and her sister partnered with UNICEF to design and produce a limited edition face mask that is accessible and sustainable.
- Despite her Australian Open titles, she has yet to lift a FrenchOpen trophy.
- When she started playing tennis, she trained at the Proworld Tennis Academy in Florida.
- She won her first grand slam when she was just 20 years old, becoming the first Japanese player to do so.
- She is a four-time grand slam singles champion.
- She bought a mansion complete with an infinity pool from Nick Jonas.
- She owns a mineral-based suncare brand called Kinlo and it specializes in chemical-free suncare that is designed for melanated skin tones.
- Osaka is described as being very shy and has struggled with mental health issues for years.
What’s Next for Naomi Osaka?
No doubt, with her passion and hard work, Naomi Osaka will continue to win victory after victory, while racking up those sponsorships and making history along the way. She is still one of the highest-paid female athletes and should remain a constant feature in celebrity net worth lists for the foreseeable future.
With four grand slam titles under her belt, she knows how to spend her prize money. She recently invested in the up-and-coming National Women’s Soccer League and is part owner of the North Carolina Courage.
Osaka is also quite the fashionista and was recently named brand ambassador for luxury brand Louis Vuitton and luxury watch brand Tag Heuer. She also partnered with Nike to design a women’s athleisurewear line and has been on the cover of Dazed and Self Magazine.
Naomi Osaka FAQs
What is Naomi Osaka Net Worth?
Naomi Osaka net worth is currently $60 million USD.
How much money does Naomi Osaka earn?
Naomi Osaka earns $57 million per year from various sources.
How tall is Naomi Osaka?
Naomi Osaka is 5 ft 11 in (1.82 m)
How old is Naomi Osaka?
Naomi Osaka is currently 28 years old.
When is Naomi Osaka birthday?
Naomi Osaka birthday is on 16th October.
